column2: LOUISIANA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: LA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: straight down the middle of the road.
column6: towards the right side of the road.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: towards the left side of the road.

column2: 2. This road sign is:
column6: a speed reduction sign.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column6: Lane closed for traffic
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 5. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 6. Green and white signs:
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 7. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column6: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 8. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column10: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 9. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: On the crosswalk.

column2: 10. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column6: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 11. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column6: Stop sign

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 13. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 14. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column6: not use high beam headlights.
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 16. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 17. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Service signs

column2: 18. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 19. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: once you have moved into the exit lane.

column2: 20. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: yellow; black

column2: 21. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column8: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 22. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 23. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the left side

column2: 24. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 25. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 26. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles are slower than cars.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 27. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Only right turns are allowed.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 28. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 29. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: slow down.

column2: 30. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column6: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 31. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: One way

column2: 33. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 34. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control

column2: 35. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a winding road.
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 36. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column6: Young people.

column2: 37. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: It is not recommended to check
column6: Never use

column2: 38. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: go the wrong way.

column2: 39. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 40. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
